divs: sighting detailsaug, 2, 2008, my wife and i and her visiting friend were walking thru our subburban neighborhood saturday evening. their was a slight breeze so it was very comfortable (no bugs) and the temporature was nice (maybe 75 f), a massive heat lightning storm was constantly lighting up the eastward sky (towards raleigh nc) from us in fuquay varina nc. no rain, no thunder. at 10:30pm (approx) my wife said "are you seeing that?" we stopped in the street and looked up and in the direction of the lightning, but between us the lightning was a single glowing silent bluish green round orb. slowing accending and getting farther away. i had no watch, cel phone nor camera of any kind. we watched it accend and fade into the distance in about 60 seconds. it had a smooth spline flight path but not exaclty straight. i moved like it could be a self-illuminated turquoise balloon. but it's size was much bigger than the regular basketball-sized party balloon. if you hold out your arm and look at your pinky fingernail. it was about that size in the sky. and we would guess a few thousand feet away at least. so i would estimate it to be at least the size of a van. maybe 1\3 the size of a hot air balloon. but a party balloon that size in the sky would only be a few houses away, maybe 200 feet. this thing was up in the sky and getting higher and "drifting" away at a pretty good speed. it had to be bigger. it glowed a strange color. not green color like a street light. more of a turquoise color. i say it was more green and my wife says it was more blue. but we both agree it was turquoise. it was completely silent. straight above us was clear sky with no clouds and bright white stars. it was not "bright" like venus was that night. it was dimmer but still clearly defined against the sky. possibly it was brighter at the center than the edges of the object but i can't say for certain. i've never seen an object that color in the sky before. if got so distant you could not see it anymore. there was a few neighbors (2 adult men) also looking in the object's direction standing in the street (probably looking at the constant lightning which was beautiful) and i was gonna ask them if they saw the object but before i reached them they went inside. i don't know them so i did not ring their doorbell. the next day i asked a few nieghbors i do know and they or course laughed and said no they didn't see anything the night before. then i googled to see if anyone else saw the object and found a wikipedia description of the same or similar turquoise object (the one i saw never grew a white comet-like tail) being spotted in nearby charlotte a year or so before. so after telling my wife that, she said i should report it. i called the local police and they said anything having to do with the sky is the faas domain. so i called them and got an answering machine. i left a message. then i left a message at my local newspaper. then i came here to report it. i dunno what esle to do. where else to go. i really want to know what it was - and stangely as i was watching it, i was already bummed out that i'll probably never know what i'm looking even is. and although, i did not have a camera i'm a graphic artist so i immediately madea composite (re-creation) photograph or what it looked like. i hope you can understand the experince we had and help discern what it might've been. someone a mile or so away launched a huge self-illuminated turquoise balloon at 10:30pm on a saturday night is my best guess.
Summary: Turquoise (bluish green) glowing sphere, silent, floating up and away, spline flight path,
